content:
Dear All,

I think that there has been a period where I was able to modify the names of the topics that I created, but I now only have the option of muting a topic.

Is anyone else observing the same change?
(There was also a fleeting period where topics could be resolved/unresolved, but, for me, that was more a bug than a feature!)
Does the dropdown menu not give you that option either?
If you hover over a message, a \vdots button appears in the top right
I just changed a setting, so that you should now be able to rename topics again
Ah, indeed! I am glad that I took a picture earlier, since I thought that I was being completely silly!

Just to answer your previous question: the vertical dots allow me to move the topic messages, various forms of quotation and edits, but they apply to the specific messages, not to the title of the topic, as far as I can tell.
I think moving and renaming are the same... but maybe not?
This topic was moved here from #Zulip meta > rename topics that I created by Damiano Testa.

Ok, they are similar: one created a new topic with the new name and notified the topic, the other silently renamed the topic.

Thanks!

I did

  • rename topics that I created --> move to --> rename/move topics that I created and got the notification
  • rename/move topics that I created --> use the edit button on top --> rename/move/rename topics that I created and no notification, but topic name changed.
Damiano Testa has marked this topic as resolved.
